inclusion.criterion: Suspected acute appendicitis on clinical and radiographic (CT) grounds
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Computed Tomography of the abdomen with contrast shows the presence of a distended appendix with thickened appendiceal wall without perforation, abscess or gangrene.

inclusion.criterion: Suspected acute appendicitis on clinical and radiographic (CT) grounds
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: The patient is a candidate for laparoscopic appendectomy under general anesthesia.

exclusion.criterion: Phlegmon, mass, peri-appendicecal abscess, or diffuse peritonitis
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Prior open laparotomy with incision through the umbilicus
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Mental illness, dementia, or inability to provide informed consent
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Chronic pain requiring daily medication (including opiate and NSAIDs)
exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: The patient is a candidate for laparoscopic appendectomy under general anesthesia.

exclusion.criterion: Alternative diagnosis found by diagnostic laparoscopy (post-randomization)
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: The patient is a 31-year-old woman complaining of abdominal pain. The pain started last night as diffuse abdominal discomfort.
